other_tests.findings: The gallbladder is mildly distended with cholelithiasis. A large impacted gallstone is seen within the gallbladder neck, measuring up to 1.5 cm. A smaller mobile 6-mm stone is also noted within the gallbladder. The gallbladder wall is normal in thickness with no pericholecystic fluid. The liver is normal in echogenicity with no focal hepatic lesion. There is no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary dilatation. The common bile duct is normal, measuring up to 2 mm in diameter. The spleen and limited evaluation of the kidneys are normal in appearance. The main portal vein is patent with appropriate direction of flow. The IVC is also normal.
